supporting_spans: "Yes, yes, your lordship," answered Captain Mangles; "and I will add that this passage of the continent will be without peril."
reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The character of Jacques Paganel in the novel contradicts the claim that he insisted on travelling light and left the team short of supplies. In fact, Paganel is described as having a bulging backpack wherever he went.

analysis.claim_text: Leading a scientific party he insisted on travelling light, leaving the team short of supplies; he watched three members die of malaria and thereafter kept a bulging backpack wherever he went.

sub_claims.text: Jacques Paganel led a scientific party.
He insisted on travelling light, leaving the team short of supplies.
Jacques Paganel watched three members die of malaria.

analysis.reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The character of Jacques Paganel in the novel contradicts the claim that he insisted on travelling light and left the team short of supplies. In fact, Paganel is described as having a bulging backpack wherever he went.
